meanings.def: coming from a particular place and having lived there for a long time before other people came there; relating to, belonging to or developed by these people
examples: the indigenous peoples/languages of an area
Guatemala has one of the highest percentages of indigenous peoples of any country in the Americas.
Antarctica has no indigenous human population.
Several indigenous African languages are used in the country.

meanings.def: having originally developed in a particular place, rather than having been brought there from somewhere else
examples: The kangaroo is indigenous to Australia.
The reserve supports a wide range of indigenous species.
